newsitem.title: USA: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Metro One up after IPO.
newsitem.headline: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Metro One up after IPO.

text.p: Metro One Telecommunications Inc, which provides directory assistance services for wireless phone companies, shot up over 20 percent after its initial public offering on the Nasdaq on Friday.
The stock rose 1-3/4 to 10-1/4 in early trading, one of the highest percent gainers on the Nasdaq. Analysts had predicted the deal would be one of the hottest market debuts this week.

Metro One offered 2.4 million shares, up from its original proposed offering of two million shares, for $8.50 each. The estimated pricing range had been $8 to $10 a share. Black & Co was lead underwriter of the offering.
Stericycle Inc shares remained mostly flat at their IPO price of $9 a share in early trading after their market debut, reaching as high as 9-1/2.
The health care waste disposal company offered three million shares, which priced below their estimated range of $10 to $12 each. The range was originally estimated at $11 to $13 each.
